content:
# The smelting process has successfully produced 5 iron plates in the furnace.
# I will now extract those iron plates to increase the number of iron plates in my inventory.

# After smelting, my inventory currently consists of:
# - 10 wood
# - 5 stone
# - 10 iron ore (remaining)
# - 5 copper ore
# - 11 copper cables
# - 5 iron gear wheels
# - 10 electronic circuits.

# Let's extract the 5 iron plates from the furnace.
extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace, quantity=5)  # Extracting the iron plates

# Now I will check my inventory after extracting the iron plates.
print(f"Inventory after extracting iron plates: {inspect_inventory()}") 

# Now I should have a total of 5 iron plates, bringing my total to 10 iron plates (5 from before + 5 now).
# I will now check if I have enough resources to craft the assembling machine again.
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronGearWheel, 0) >= 10, "Not enough iron gears to craft the assembling machine."
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 10, "Not enough iron plates to craft the assembling machine."
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.Wood, 0) >= 5, "Not enough wood to craft the assembling machine."
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.ElectronicCircuit, 0) >= 10, "Not enough electronic circuits to craft the assembling machine."

# Now that I have enough materials, I can attempt to craft the assembling machine again.
craft_item(Prototype.AssemblingMachine1)  # Crafting the assembling machine

# Checking inventory after crafting the assembling machine.
print(f"Inventory after crafting the assembling machine: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
